Sentencas: First-principles quantum simulations complemented with kinetic Monte Carlo calculations were performed to gain insight into the oxygen vacancy diffusion mechanism and to explain the effect of dopant composition on ionic conductivity in yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ).
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: Density-functional theory (DFT) within the local-density approximation with gradient correction was used to calculate a set of energy barriers that oxygen ions encounter during migration in YSZ by a vacancy mechanism.
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: Kinetic Monte Carlo simulations were then performed using Boltzmann probabilities based on the calculated DFT barriers to determine the dopant concentration dependence of the oxygen self-diffusion coefficient in (Y2O3)(x)(ZrO2)((1-2x)) with x increasing from 6% to 15%.
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: The results from the simulations suggest that the maximum conductivity occurs at 7-9 mol % Y2O3 at 600-1500 K and that the effective activation energy increases at higher Y doping concentrations in good agreement with previously reported literature data.
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: The increase in the effective activation energy for migration arises from the higher-energy barrier for oxygen vacancy diffusion across an Y-Y common edge relative to diffusion across one with a Zr-Y common edge of two adjacent tetrahedra.
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: The binding energies between oxygen vacancies and dopants were extracted up to the fourth nearest-neighbor interaction.
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: Our results reveal that the binding energy is the strongest when the vacancy is in the second nearest-neighbor position relative to the Y dopant atom.
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: The methodology was also applied to scandium-doped zirconia (SDZ).
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: Preliminary results from quantum simulations of SDZ suggest that the effective activation energy for vacancy diffusion in SDZ is lower than that of YSZ, in agreement with experimental observations.
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles

Sentencas: The agreement with experimental studies on the two systems analyzed in this paper supports the use of this technique as a predictive tool on electrolyte systems not yet characterized experimentally.
Titulo: Predicting ionic conductivity of solid oxide fuel cell electrolyte from first principles
